description: Back-formation from Middle English part-takinge, part-takynge (“a sharing; partaking”), a calque of Latin particeps (“participating”); equivalent to part +‎ take. Compare take part.

verbs.description: partake (third-person singular simple present partakes, present participle partaking, simple past partook, past participle partaken)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, formal) To take part in an activity; to participate.
(intransitive) To take a share or portion (of or in).
examples: Will you partake of some food?

entries.meaning: (intransitive, archaic) To have something of the properties, character, or office (of).
examples: the Attorney of the Duchy of Lancaster , who partakes of both qualities, partly of a judge in the court, and partly of an attorney-general
